article.title: Relationship types
article.para: A content object can have two basic types of relationships within a DITA map:

listitem.para: Such relationships to content objects that are nearby in the navigation hierarchy include parent, previous, next, and child relationships. A content object that appears in more than one position within the hierarchy can have different relationships in different contexts. Nearby content often contributes to a larger composite content object.
Such relationships can cut across the navigation hierarchy and, in some respects, resemble a see-also relationship in an index.
